    Enable video call from audio call

    1 minute read

    An application can enable video call in the middle of an audio call. The API procedure for enabling video call is differ depends on the call service type.

    • 1:1 call
    • Conference

    1:1 call

    The video call requester side always sends its camera stream, but the peer has two available scenarios. And the scenarios are decided by the callParam::responseOnEnableVideo field value.

    callParam means arguments in makeCall() and verifyCall() API. The exact name could be different with the client implementations.

    1. Mannually respond video streaming
      • callParam::responseOnEnableVideo = PAUSE
        This lets start video call but paused status. The video call request receiver(Client 02) can choose timing to send its camera stream.
    2. Automatically respond video streaming
      • callParam::responseOnEnableVideo = SEND
        The video call request receiver(Client 02) sends its stream when the request arrives.

    Recommand the application fixes on one user scenario.
    This means using constant callParam::responseOnEnableVideo field value - PAUSE or SEND


    If application want to stop video streaming in the video call, call disableVideo() API with a disableReason value.

    Flow example for DECLINE case

    If the counterpart of the enableVideo() want not to start video call, namely want to decline the video call, the call procedure should be shown following:

    • callParam::responseOnEnableVideo = PAUSE

    Camera open failure case

    If a client receives evtVideoEnableByPeer event but fails to open camera device, the client should call resumeMyVideo() after successfully reopening its camera device.



    Conference

    1. Enable video
      When calls enableVideo(), the video call requester side always sends its camera stream such as 1:1 call’s. And each participants decide whether if receive a video stream or not by calling requestPeerVideo() API.

    2. Disable video
      If application want to stop video streaming in the video call, call disableVideo() API as with 1:1 call.

    Note
    disableReason is not working in Conference.

    History

    2020-11-24 Change PlanetKit API

    • addMember() –> requestPeerVideo()

    2020-10-16 the first version

    Tags: function

    Updated: November 24, 2020
